results.title: Primary hyperepinephrinemia in patients without pheochromocytoma.
results.text_hl: Clinical features of @CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@epinephrine@@@ release led to the finding of spontaneously elevated plasma @CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@epinephrine@@@ concentrations in five @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, in four of whom plasma @CHEMICAL_Norepinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009638 @@@norepinephrine@@@ concentrations were normal. @<m>DISEASE_Adrenal_Hyperplasia_Congenital</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000312 @@@Adrenal medullary hyperplasia@@@ was suspected in one @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@, whose first cousin had @DISEASE_Multiple_Endocrine_Neoplasia_Type_2a @DISEASE_MESH:D018813 @@@multiple endocrine neoplasia type IIa@@@, and in two others, all of whom have experienced relief from symptoms during @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ administration.

citations.NLM: Streeten DH, Anderson GH Jr, Lebowitz M, Speller PJ. Primary hyperepinephrinemia in patients without pheochromocytoma. Arch Intern Med. 1990 Jul;150(7):1528-33. PMID: 2369252
